snippet: The report found that costs associated with incarceration, like traveling for prison visits, had pushed more than one-third of the families into debt.
abstract: Report by Ella Baker Center for Human Rights finds almost two-thirds of families that have member in jail or prison have trouble meeting their basic needs; finds 50 percent of families cannot afford enough food and substantial housing, and more than one-third are in debt.
lead_paragraph: The report found that costs associated with incarceration, like traveling for prison visits, had pushed more than one-third of the families into debt.

headline.main: Report Details Economic Hardships for Inmate Families
headline.print_headline: Report Details the Economic Hardships That Many Families of Inmates Face
